txt.en: 'Are you here to ask after my son Grimbold? Alas, he is away at the Fords. He is a great Thane, and I watch for his return every day. I know Erkenbrand will take good care of him.'
Townsfolk of Grimslade can be found in the town.\n\nYou should speak to townsfolk of Grimslade.

'It is wartime, and our food-stores are alarmingly low now that our supply-lines are cut off. Lady Ã‰owyn has left Meduseld empty, Marton is silent, and the people of Rohan fear to use the roads. We must bolster our supplies.'
'I cannot talk now, stranger. If you wish to make yourself useful, you will help us make more arrows for defending our walls.'
Hildith is in the Mead Hall of Grimslade.\n\nYou should return to Hildith.
'Let us discuss the matters at hand.'
The unfriendly acting Thane, Hildith, grows concerned with the state of the Westfold, and summons a council to her, and does not wish to be disturbed while she calls the meeting.

'I will summon a small council to discuss the tidings you bring, stranger. You may leave my presence. I have no further need of you until I have gathered the council here.\n\n'If you wish to occupy yourself, you may speak to the townsfolk.'
'I am Grimwald, son of Grimbold! My father is away at the fords, and now my mother is Thane in his place.\n\n'Where are you from? You have very strange clothing.'
